prefix_free_compressors module

class prefix_free_compressors.PrefixFreeTree(prob_dist: core.prob_dist.ProbabilityDist)

class prefix_free_compressors.PrefixFreeTreeDecoder(prob_dist: core.prob_dist.ProbabilityDist)

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataDecoder

decode_block(bitarray: bitarray.bitarray)

decode the data_block using the PrefixFreeTree

as prefix free codes have specific code for each symbol, and due to the prefix free nature, allow for decoding each symbol from the stream, we implement decode_block function as a simple loop over decode_symbol function.

decode_symbol(encoded_bitarray)

decode each symbol by parsing through the prefix free tree

  • start from the root node

  • if the next bit is 0, go left, else right

  • once you reach a leaf node, output the symbol corresponding the node

class prefix_free_compressors.PrefixFreeTreeEncoder(prob_dist: core.prob_dist.ProbabilityDist)

Bases: core.data_encoder_decoder.DataEncoder

encode_block(data_block: core.data_block.DataBlock)

encode the data_block using the PrefixFreeTree

as prefix free codes have specific code for each symbol, we implement encode_block function as a simple loop over encode_symbol function.

encode_symbol(s)

encode each symbol based on the lookup table

class prefix_free_compressors.PrefixFreeTreeNode(left_child: Optional[Any] = None, right_child: Optional[Any] = None, id: Optional[Any] = None, code: str = bitarray())

Bases: utils.tree_utils.BinaryNode

PrefixFreeTreeNode is sublass of BinaryNode, as we need to add the “code” attribute

The code attribute is used to get an encoding table. FIXME: not sure if we really need the code field, although it does make the algorithm to get the encoding table quite simple

code: str = bitarray()
get_encoding_table() → Mapping[str, bitarray.bitarray]

parse the node and get the encoding table
